name: Katherine Mamouzellos
text: We went to Frazier Christmas Tree Farm thinking it was still open for the season because it said so on google and when we got there called to know where to enter. The owner said they were closed for the season, he’s sorry, and directed us to the nearest farm which was another 30 min away. We had already driven an hr. Not even 5 min later we got a call back from the owner. He said that he saw he was showing as open on google and since that’s the reason we came he would meet us at the farm so that we can pick out a Christmas tree of our liking! This business owner knows how to make his customers happy and shows great love for others and the holidays! He’s a very kind and humble man. We ended up cutting ourselves a beautiful tree. On top of such an amazing experience, the owner has a Christmas light show that runs for about 30 min where the lights are in sync with the music. I couldn’t be more thankful for this kind heart. I highly recommend Frazier Christmas Tree Farm!

name: Tamyra Gwin
text: What an amazing time we had!  This will definitely be a new holiday tradition for us. We LOVED it! !!! What a special treat.

name: Angelic Holbrook
text: Was very nice.  Enjoyed the people, selection and price. Just wished there was an area for picture taking.

name: Nicole Marie
text: We visited this farm last year and had a wonderful time. The people were very friendly and there were a lot of trees to choose from. We will be heading back there for our Christmas's tree again this year!

name: Justin Cooper
text: Super friendly folks, very nice trees, and great prices.  Definitely and enjoyable experience.

name: Josh Player
text: We love this place and the people!! This is a family tradition for us every year usually the day after Thanksgiving!!! Could not ask for better people or experience!!

name: William Hudson
text: They were very welcoming

name: S Turner
text: Friendliest people and nice selection of trees.  We will definitely be back next year!

name: Misty Merilien
text: Family friendly and a wonderful tradition!

name: Misty Merilien
text: Family friendly and a wonderful tradition!

name: dan moulton
text:
Schwerman's is closed for the most part.  Public Service Announcement - see email to customers on 10/27/19 below. They are honest about what happened to cause the lack of trees. Gonna miss them!

"Hello to our loyal Christmas tree farm customers:

After Christmas 2018, we had rain, rain and more rain.  So much rain that the Tennessee River overflowed its banks and did not go away completely for almost 3 months.  Unfortunately, many of our trees could not
survive with the roots underwater for that long.  Then came the drought.  With the trees under more stress, it was not possible to groom them to make them look perfect.

We lost all the seedlings and most of the 6-10 foot trees.  And many of the larger trees that did survive have brown limbs in one or more places - definitely not suitable for your holiday celebration.

However, Roger and I will open the farm  Thanksgiving weekend only this year (Friday, Nov. 29, Saturday, November 30, and Sunday December 1) from noon until dark. But for you, our loyal customers, we will do our best to accommodate your schedules - but call us first so we know when to meet you.

We still have plenty of perfect trees to sell, so come by that weekend and enjoy your traditional visit.  We'd love to see you and I know our animals would appreciate your visit.  We will also have our hot chocolate
and hot cider!

Unfortunately, Santa made other arrangements this year so he will not be visiting.

We are not selling the farm, just not planting any more trees.  We still have the cows, horses, donkeys, mules, chickens and goats, and of course Sophie, our "puppy".  We also have fresh farm eggs to sell (we do this all year, so call if you need some).

Thank you for your loyalty and business for the 18 years we have owned the Christmas tree farm.  Without you it would not have been so much fun.

Sincerely,

Roger and Pat Schwerman
Schwerman Christmas Tree Plantation
Lacey's Spring, Alabama"

name: Jesse Porter
text: Sorry to the owners but I felt it necessary to leave this review.  We have gone to this farm several times since our boys were young. It was always a good experience, but not now. None of the trees had been trimmed, but they did offer to trim after we cut. That does not provide a pretty tree properly shaped with new growth. We saw no usable trees.  All were way to tall and big for the typical home. No evidence of regular planting of trees with various ages to select from. We did see one small section of newer trees but they will not be ready for a couple of year.  I would not leave a review except I truly believe this farm is disappointing young children that are excited about the chance to select and cut a tree. Our kids are in college now and we thought it would be fun to cut a tree one last time. It was simply not possible here. We had to go to another farm and barely had time due to the wasted time coming here. The other farm is closing down after this weekend so I am not sure if there is any place near Huntsville that offers the chance for families to cut their own tree.  No big loss for us but I feel bad for those with young kids.

name: Kim Ward
text: Took our family and had a great experience! Our kids absolutely loved walking the farm to find our perfect Christmas tree. The owners were very friendly and kind and helped us get the tree back after we cut it. They netted it and helped us load it up. I read the other reviews about the trees not being trimmed and people not even stopping. That's ridiculous to me because it is a tree farm so the trees grow natural. When you find the tree you want, they will trim them for you before you leave. They ask you what you want trimmed. That is part of the magic of this place. You get to pick out, cut down, and shape your own tree. We loved the whole experience! Last year we purchased a live tree that was already cut and trimmed and every tree to choose from looked exactly the same, and it was like why even walk around to pick one out because they are all identical. This year we wanted our kids to have a unique experience. We  went out in the cold rain and did this and all three of our kids said it was the best Christmas tree experience they have ever had and they can not wait to do this again. When you have kids out in the rain and cold and they are still having fun, that is saying a lot, but that is because the tree is only part of this experience. The time spent with family walking around and making a family decision on a tree and then working together to cut it down and get it home...It's so much fun. We will definitely be back next year!

name: Pat Schwerman
text: I’m sorry some contributors don’t like the natural shape of our trees. We prune/shape about 50% of the trees before the season, sometimes twice a year. The rest we shape “on demand”. If you find your tree and it needs more shaping, we are more than happy to comply with any requests. There is a tree for everyone if you just take the time to walk around the farm and breath some of the fresh air and enjoy a stress free visit. Merry Christmas to all our friends and customers who come year after year, and to our new friends who are just finding us.  Pat and Roger Schwerman.

name: Patricia Curtis
text: Very nice place friendly owners and Sophie the  beautiful farm dog! Enjoyed ourselves

name: Jill Benefield
text: Time wasted.  Drove 45 minutes to find trees not suitable for a Christmas tree.  They do not prune throughout the year so they are unkept and not shaped right for a Christmas tree.  I felt bad taking my kids and leaving without a tree but there honestly was not one tree that was pretty or doable .  If you want a Leland cypress you might have a tree you like but all the other types were horrible. However the owners are super sweet and Santa was there.

name: Ryan Barnard
text: Went there today to find a tree with my family. We just pulled in and turned around and left. The trees were not shaped or kept up and they do not have a selection suitable for a Christmas tree farm any more. This place use to be great but it's not anymore.

name: Kami Drake
text: We love this family tradition, the owners are so kind and sweet and the kids love the little ride, sleigh photo area and of course (a really great easy going) Santa!

name: Kaleb Simpson
text: I’m giving this place a HORRIBLE review, I spoke to a woman on the phone and she was terribly rude to me!😵😵😵😵😵

name: MariBeth Poor
text: For 10 years we got our tree from pine hill. We always enjoyed our experience and got a great tree. Last year we went to the farm and the selection was not great so we thought maybe it was an off year. But when we went back this year, again the tree selection was EXTREMELY limited. The people there are always friendly and explained that their pre-order business is now so big that it limits the selection for walk ins. We hope to be back to pine hill one day but will take a few years off to let their selection hopefully build back up.

name: Alexandria Nichols
text: I love this place! I used to go when I was a child but this year I went with my husband. It was our first Christmas married so we wanted it to be special and it definitely was a great experience!

name: becky white
text: I am one of the parents that was with my daughter for a photo shoot. There were several of us. I learned a few things today. First, always check websites and call before you go to a place to have pictures taken. People are not nice these days and today we all witnessed that. Our girls were simply taking some senior pictures. We did not mind at all paying a fee (which was paid before we left) or buying anything (which a wreath was bought). However, simply telling a group of girls with their moms and photographer that pictures are not allowed during business hours would have been sufficient enough. Instead the old man on the tractor came up to us yelling not only at our photographer but our girls. When we went in to talk to the wife about paying to take the picture, we said he was very aggressive when he came up to us. They laughed. Needless to say we all decided to leave and we will not be back EVER!  I definitely do not recommend this place to anyone. I think this business missed the lesson on kindness. Kindness is free it doesn’t cost a thing to be kind!!

name: A Robin
text: Got our tree at Pine Hill Farms!  6.5 ft for $68.

name: Heather Mcmullin
text: Wonderful experience!! Very friendly and helpful staff!!

name: dusty parker
text: After 15  years we will never be back after the way we were treated today.  Had a college student that's was struggling financially come out with us to take pictures with our tree this year.  The folks there who have always been friendly told us that we were to pay a 25 dollars fee to use their facility for professional pictures. I pleaded with them on the matter but was told its on the website.  We decided not to purchase the tree that we picked out and was told that we had to or face legal charges it. We were then cursed at  by the outside employees and told to get out of here This is not how you treat customers.  Remember 15 years we have gone there.  This place has gone down. So sad to end a family tradition on such a sad note and to have your children cry on the way home.  I will say thank you for all the great memories.

name: John Jones
text: WONDERFUL experience. The service was amazing: the staff is friendly, welcoming, and helpful. They had a very large selection of trees which they cut and secure to your car. In the warm gift shop we were offered free hot chocolate and apple cider. Would 100% recommend and will likely return.

name: Zavier De'Sine
text:
This is THE place to get your Christmas tree. You can cut your own if you want, the staff is made up of very polite, local teens. The owners usually are in gift shop and supervising the staff.

They have a tractor ride that goes around the farm and have reindeer ( caribou) you can see.

They have a free hot cocoa and apple cider station.

They have a gift shop with a beautiful array of ornaments. This is where you pay for your tree. Not a place to take your child as some of the ornaments are fragile.

The gift shop is not handicapped wheelchair friendly

A large variety of pre cut 6' - 10 foot trees, you can even have your tree choice flocked (sprayed to look like a snow covered tree).

Dog friendly but they do have to be leashed.

For the cost conscious if it's a lot closers to Christmas, they may give you a discount.

It is just an amazing experience, not to be missed if you have small children with you.

name: Richard Estes
text: Pre-ordered tree like we do every year.  Showed up with family to pick it out this year because last years tree was so small and they have no record of our order and can't get us a tree until middle of December.  Literally spent 30 minutes on the phone with the lady arranging the appointment etc.  Probably end up being a good thing as all the trees looked pretty rough.

name: Jessica Norwood
text: Really nice people, great family time. Picked out our tree and had hot chocolate and also took a hay ride. Cute little store also!

name: Wanda Goolsby
text: Was a great place to purchase Christmas trees, they even let us tag the one we wanted for this year when we bought ours last year. The problem is that when we got there today the one that had our name & SOLD on it was gone. They didn't honor their agreement.  We'll probably go back next year unless we can find another tree farm that sells re-plantable Christmas trees.

name: HTMUSH Gear
text: The Best Days have Come and Gone!  We have purchased trees here for years but the quality, service and price have gone this year.  We always order in advance and show up on the date they tell us to, to pick up our trees.  We paid $150 for the smallest and ugliest single tree we have ever gotten from this place.  They had zero.  We were return customers - that buy a minimum of 2 trees -per year from them but I'm sorry to say I not only will not go back next year but I feel totally lied to by Pine Hill Farms.  They did not have our standard HUGE tree for us.  This year's tree is pathetic excuse for a Christmas tree.  We ended up going somewhere else and buying two and donating the Pine Hill Tree to a charity.

name: The Carver Family
text: Our family has been cutting our own trees for Christmas from this farm since 2006. Each year it has been a great experience with friendly staff and a great atmosphere.

name: Lizzy
text: CRAZY Expensive this year!! Not as many choices. 11/29/20

name: Samantha
text: This place was an absolute waste of time and gas.  We arrived to find nothing but tiny or misshapen trees, some even dying already.  The pre-cut selection was underwhelmingly small and nothing but 10ft plus and over hundreds of dollars.  Price differentials were outrageous between cut or dug. We will never be back and I'm extremely disappointed that we wasted our first experience as a family driving out here.

name: gabi p
text: We cut a fresh Cyprus tree from them two weeks before  Christmas  and it has withered up and died within a week and a half, even though we watered it daliy. They were very rude and wouldn't refund or replace the tree. Looks like we will be having a treeless Christmas! #theGrincheswhostolechristmas

name: Ginger Beasley
text: Great place to work!

name: Jasonlee Gross Thornhill
text: Best place to get a Christmas tree or just have a good family outting

name: Tara Maddox
text: This place is awesome! Only place we want to ship for live and flocked trees; however, they were unfortunately hit by a tornado which took most everything down.  Hope they get back to their former glory; it was magical!!

name: angie tidwell
text: Good christian family runs and owns this business. The kids i know. Love going there during holidays

name: Debbie Kiser
text:
What Great People Own this Tree Farm!!Specializing in Christmas. Trees!!
Must Go around December First, when. The SANTA TRAIN. WILL RIDE ALL THRU THE TREE "VILLAGE"  AND SERVE Hot Chocolate!!    SOMETIMES. THE BIG FELLA EVEN. SHOWS UP.  A MUST!!!

name: Cat Curtis
text: Was happy to find a place that had both types of live trees, cut down AND in a pot.

name: Laura Craver
text: Everyone is extremely nice and helpful. Great fun for the whole family.

name: Han Lukin
text: Family owned,  nice people.  We have made it a tradition and come every year for over 12 years now

name: Breanna Wagner
text: Best Christmas tree shopping ever

name: Robert Jackson
text: Great place to harvest your own Christmas tree! They also have already cut trees as well. Good place been going there for a few years now.

name: lisa Okoniewski
text: Great place to buy a Christmas tree.  Very reasonable prices for great trees.  Everyone was nice and helpful. .

name: Nena Lynn Gregory
text: Beautiful trees, large selection, great prices!!

name: John Lapczynski
text: Great People here with a great selection. If you need a tree in the Mobile area come here and you will get all you need. They also offer flocked trees.

name: David Snider
text:
Great place for the family to go and find that perfect tree in the wild. The helpers were kind and did a fantastic job binding and securing the tree to the vehicle for transport. This place takes you back to childhood, simple farm, bow saw, cash only, and lots of fun laughing and playing with family. Keep up the great work and thanks for providing a great place to pass this tradition on to my kids.

Take cash no cards accepted!

name: Michelle Howell
text: This was my first time doing anything like this. I'm a city girl and used to getting my tree from the store or the box. I'm glad I looked at the reviews and calling for assistance. Everyone I spoke to was very helpful. I did hope for more of a selection but I finally found my Charlie Brown tree. I'm putting it up now and can't wait to see the finished product!

name: A M
text: We just drove 2hrs like we do every year just to get a hand written sign on the fence saying out of business! No more valley tree farm.  They really need to update there website bc many ppl will waist there time and gas!! Not cool!!!

name: Keff Edwards
text: Family Tradition for real, I have been getting trees from here for the last 18 years.  Thank you for being a big part of my life.  I do agree you need to start taking cards but not enough to drop stars.

name: Amanda Murphy
text:
I would have loved to get a tree from this farm, but my husband and I made a whole morning of getting breakfast and going to get our tree this weekend and when we finally got there, after driving for forty minutes, we found out that they only accept cash or checks. (Neither of which we had on our person.) I specifically checked their website and google reviews and neither made any mention of needing cash.

It looked nice, but coming from a farming family myself, I know just how easy it is to get a Square device so you may accept cards. Many small businesses around Huntsville have devices to accept debit and credit cards. If this tree farm is unable to use a Square device for any reason, it would be good business to mention the need for cash or check on their website or google page.

I'm sure their trees are lovely, but make sure to bring check or cash if you plan to visit.

name: Charles and Jennifer Martin
text: My family and I get our Christmas trees here every year. A great place for a tradition!

name: Michael Melton
text: Nice place.  Nice folks!

name: Richard Flood
text: Mr. Shell is a great American. His family business is a must see venue for folks seeking to cut their own Christmas tree...and enjoy a hot cup of apple cider in the process!

name: Tyler Oliver
text: Great place, great prices and an amazing atmosphere! My wife and I have been going here for 6 years and we love it here! Our kids love running through the field of trees and look forward to our trip every year.

name: Carl Holt
text: Business is not enforcing the state mask mandate. Doing NOTHING to encourage mask wearing or social distancing. People are allowed to gather close together and inside without masks or social distancing.

name: Walter Simpson
text: My friend owns this farm, it is the best!

name: jenn viall
text: Loved it!! Beautiful trees everywhere. Highly recommend. Great Family outing 🤗

name: Morgan Phippen
text: Awesome experience. Shell's has a great selection of beautiful trees for most any budget. The day we went was a little chilly but they had delicious hot apple cider. Everyone was very friendly and treated us like family, even Kate, the dog. I highly recommend skipping the big box store uncertainty and going to Shell's. They've got it goin on.

name: Christian Williams
text: The staff treated us like family.  Great family experience

name: Hair and makeup By Kaitlyn
text: Great service all together

name: Stephen Gray
text: Best Christmas tree we have ever gotten. Staff was great and really had a blast doing this as a family.

name: Wesley Reuck
text: Great Christian business.

name: brandon pittman
text: Nice tree farm. Good looking trees. Not many small trees left. We bought a 8 foot Leyland cypress and it is a gorgeous 🌲. They have Fraser firs and Carolina sapphires as well . The Fraser firs are not grown at their farm.

name: Benji Turley
text: Find somewhere else to do business and also don't do business with them if they want to buy from you. You'll be better off trust me.

name: Susie E Moon
text: Great Christmas tree farm...Great place to make memories with family...🎄🎅🏼

name: Deb Baker
text: Great place to get a Christmas Tree.  Very friendly, helpful staff and beautiful trees.
